forementioned alternate queue assignment

,

> > > 1,146,463 URLs loaded via the importUris JMX command with the=
 heap
> > > climbing to 1,869,072 KB.  I just started the job and I'll keep=
 y'all
> > > apprised of the memory situation as it runs.
> >

nning out of memory, the final statiscal count was 151889
> > downloads out=
 of 4473197 potential (the bar graph on the summary
> > page).
> 
> That is=
 a small number of downloads.  I'm guessing whats killing you is
> the numb=
er of queues.  Whats the frontier report say about queues?

Sorry.  I neede=
d to do other work on the machine in the meantime and I
ran some other jobs=
, so I don't believe I have access to the frontier
queue anymore (am I wron=
g?).

> Did you use the suggested alternate queue policy so there isn't a q=
ueue
> per host?

I did, in fact.

> You could also set the hold-queues to =
be true so that heritrix focuses
> on a server giving it a chance to crawl =
a queue to completion.

In the new run, its setup this way.

> > The proble=
m, as I see it, is that the 4.4M number should never
> > have been that hig=
h.  After I loaded the 1.1M seeds, the number of
> > potential pages was ar=
ound twice that (I'm guessing because of DNS?).
> 
> Yeah.  And robots.
> 
=
> > Because the attempt was to configure Heritrix to not download any
> > p=
ages but the seeds, clearly something has gone wrong.  The extra
> > pages =
being scheduled is what is driving the memory needs up.
> 
> See above.

I =
just re-ran the job and noticed that my "rejecthops" rule is not
working co=
rrectly.  While it is PASS'ing on some URL's that were not
part of the orig=
inal file (incorrect), it is REJECT'ing others
(correct).  The only reason =
I can think that it should be PASS'ing
some (besides a bug in either my con=
figuration or Heritrix) is because
of a redirection which might be consider=
ed analogous to the original
url passed in through importUris.  Does that m=
ake sense?

What's the PrerequisiteAcceptRule do?  My TooManyHopsDecideRule=
 is set
at 1.  Should it be set at 0?

Thanks for your continued help.

-ma=
tt
